document.comment: Generated automatically from Godot engine sources.

section.title: TextParagraph
section.paragraph: Holds a paragraph of text.

section.title: Description
section.paragraph: Abstraction over TextServer for handling a single paragraph of text.

entry.paragraph: add_object(key: Variant, size: Vector2, inline_align: InlineAlignment = 5, length: int = 1, baseline: float = 0.0)
add_string(text: String, font: Font, font_size: int, language: String = "", meta: Variant = null)
draw(canvas: RID, pos: Vector2, color: Color = Color(1, 1, 1, 1), dc_color: Color = Color(1, 1, 1, 1), oversampling: float = 0.0) const
draw_dropcap(canvas: RID, pos: Vector2, color: Color = Color(1, 1, 1, 1), oversampling: float = 0.0) const
draw_dropcap_outline(canvas: RID, pos: Vector2, outline_size: int = 1, color: Color = Color(1, 1, 1, 1), oversampling: float = 0.0) const
draw_line(canvas: RID, pos: Vector2, line: int, color: Color = Color(1, 1, 1, 1), oversampling: float = 0.0) const
draw_line_outline(canvas: RID, pos: Vector2, line: int, outline_size: int = 1, color: Color = Color(1, 1, 1, 1), oversampling: float = 0.0) const
draw_outline(canvas: RID, pos: Vector2, outline_size: int = 1, color: Color = Color(1, 1, 1, 1), dc_color: Color = Color(1, 1, 1, 1), oversampling: float = 0.0) const
resize_object(key: Variant, size: Vector2, inline_align: InlineAlignment = 5, baseline: float = 0.0)
set_dropcap(text: String, font: Font, font_size: int, dropcap_margins: Rect2 = Rect2(0, 0, 0, 0), language: String = "")

section.title: Property Descriptions
section.paragraph: HorizontalAlignment alignment = 0 ðŸ”—
Paragraph horizontal alignment.
BitField[LineBreakFlag] break_flags = 3 ðŸ”—
Line breaking rules. For more info see TextServer.
String custom_punctuation = "" ðŸ”—
Custom punctuation character list, used for word breaking. If set to empty string, server defaults are used.
Direction direction = 0 ðŸ”—
Text writing direction.
String ellipsis_char = "â€¦" ðŸ”—
Ellipsis character used for text clipping.
BitField[JustificationFlag] justification_flags = 163 ðŸ”—
Line fill alignment rules.
float line_spacing = 0.0 ðŸ”—
Additional vertical spacing between lines (in pixels), spacing is added to line descent. This value can be negative.
int max_lines_visible = -1 ðŸ”—
Limits the lines of text shown.
Orientation orientation = 0 ðŸ”—
Text orientation.
bool preserve_control = false ðŸ”—
If set to true text will display control characters.
bool preserve_invalid = true ðŸ”—
If set to true text will display invalid characters.
OverrunBehavior text_overrun_behavior = 0 ðŸ”—
The clipping behavior when the text exceeds the paragraph's set width.
float width = -1.0 ðŸ”—
Paragraph width.

section.title: Method Descriptions
section.paragraph: bool add_object(key: Variant, size: Vector2, inline_align: InlineAlignment = 5, length: int = 1, baseline: float = 0.0) ðŸ”—
Adds inline object to the text buffer, key must be unique. In the text, object is represented as length object replacement characters.
bool add_string(text: String, font: Font, font_size: int, language: String = "", meta: Variant = null) ðŸ”—
Adds text span and font to draw it.
void clear() ðŸ”—
Clears text paragraph (removes text and inline objects).
void clear_dropcap() ðŸ”—
Removes dropcap.
void draw(canvas: RID, pos: Vector2, color: Color = Color(1, 1, 1, 1), dc_color: Color = Color(1, 1, 1, 1), oversampling: float = 0.0) const ðŸ”—

Draw all lines of the text and drop cap into a canvas item at a given position, with color. pos specifies the top left corner of the bounding box. If oversampling is greater than zero, it is used as font oversampling factor, otherwise viewport oversampling settings are used.
void draw_dropcap(canvas: RID, pos: Vector2, color: Color = Color(1, 1, 1, 1), oversampling: float = 0.0) const ðŸ”—

Draw drop cap into a canvas item at a given position, with color. pos specifies the top left corner of the bounding box. If oversampling is greater than zero, it is used as font oversampling factor, otherwise viewport oversampling settings are used.
void draw_dropcap_outline(canvas: RID, pos: Vector2, outline_size: int = 1, color: Color = Color(1, 1, 1, 1), oversampling: float = 0.0) const ðŸ”—

Draw drop cap outline into a canvas item at a given position, with color. pos specifies the top left corner of the bounding box. If oversampling is greater than zero, it is used as font oversampling factor, otherwise viewport oversampling settings are used.
void draw_line(canvas: RID, pos: Vector2, line: int, color: Color = Color(1, 1, 1, 1), oversampling: float = 0.0) const ðŸ”—

Draw single line of text into a canvas item at a given position, with color. pos specifies the top left corner of the bounding box. If oversampling is greater than zero, it is used as font oversampling factor, otherwise viewport oversampling settings are used.
void draw_line_outline(canvas: RID, pos: Vector2, line: int, outline_size: int = 1, color: Color = Color(1, 1, 1, 1), oversampling: float = 0.0) const ðŸ”—

Draw outline of the single line of text into a canvas item at a given position, with color. pos specifies the top left corner of the bounding box. If oversampling is greater than zero, it is used as font oversampling factor, otherwise viewport oversampling settings are used.
void draw_outline(canvas: RID, pos: Vector2, outline_size: int = 1, color: Color = Color(1, 1, 1, 1), dc_color: Color = Color(1, 1, 1, 1), oversampling: float = 0.0) const ðŸ”—

Draw outlines of all lines of the text and drop cap into a canvas item at a given position, with color. pos specifies the top left corner of the bounding box. If oversampling is greater than zero, it is used as font oversampling factor, otherwise viewport oversampling settings are used.
TextParagraph duplicate() const ðŸ”—
Duplicates this TextParagraph.
int get_dropcap_lines() const ðŸ”—
Returns number of lines used by dropcap.
RID get_dropcap_rid() const ðŸ”—
Returns drop cap text buffer RID.
Vector2 get_dropcap_size() const ðŸ”—
Returns drop cap bounding box size.
Direction get_inferred_direction() const ðŸ”—
Returns the text writing direction inferred by the BiDi algorithm.
float get_line_ascent(line: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns the text line ascent (number of pixels above the baseline for horizontal layout or to the left of baseline for vertical).
int get_line_count() const ðŸ”—
Returns number of lines in the paragraph.
float get_line_descent(line: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns the text line descent (number of pixels below the baseline for horizontal layout or to the right of baseline for vertical).
Rect2 get_line_object_rect(line: int, key: Variant) const ðŸ”—
Returns bounding rectangle of the inline object.
Array get_line_objects(line: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns array of inline objects in the line.
Vector2i get_line_range(line: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns character range of the line.
RID get_line_rid(line: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns TextServer line buffer RID.
Vector2 get_line_size(line: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns size of the bounding box of the line of text. Returned size is rounded up.
float get_line_underline_position(line: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns pixel offset of the underline below the baseline.
float get_line_underline_thickness(line: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns thickness of the underline.
float get_line_width(line: int) const ðŸ”—
Returns width (for horizontal layout) or height (for vertical) of the line of text.
Vector2 get_non_wrapped_size() const ðŸ”—
Returns the size of the bounding box of the paragraph, without line breaks.
Vector2i get_range() const ðŸ”—
Returns the character range of the paragraph.
RID get_rid() const ðŸ”—
Returns TextServer full string buffer RID.
Vector2 get_size() const ðŸ”—
Returns the size of the bounding box of the paragraph.
bool has_object(key: Variant) const ðŸ”—
Returns true if an object with key is embedded in this shaped text buffer.
int hit_test(coords: Vector2) const ðŸ”—
Returns caret character offset at the specified coordinates. This function always returns a valid position.
bool resize_object(key: Variant, size: Vector2, inline_align: InlineAlignment = 5, baseline: float = 0.0) ðŸ”—
Sets new size and alignment of embedded object.
void set_bidi_override(override: Array) ðŸ”—
Overrides BiDi for the structured text.
Override ranges should cover full source text without overlaps. BiDi algorithm will be used on each range separately.
bool set_dropcap(text: String, font: Font, font_size: int, dropcap_margins: Rect2 = Rect2(0, 0, 0, 0), language: String = "") ðŸ”—
Sets drop cap, overrides previously set drop cap. Drop cap (dropped capital) is a decorative element at the beginning of a paragraph that is larger than the rest of the text.
void tab_align(tab_stops: PackedFloat32Array) ðŸ”—
Aligns paragraph to the given tab-stops.

abbreviation.explanation: This method should typically be overridden by the user to have any effect.
This method is required to be overridden when extending its base class.
This method has no side effects. It doesn't modify any of the instance's member variables.
This method accepts any number of arguments after the ones described here.
This method is used to construct a type.
This method doesn't need an instance to be called, so it can be called directly using the class name.
This method describes a valid operator to use with this type as left-hand operand.
This value is an integer composed as a bitmask of the following flags.
